history.content: It's merely a recommendation from Berkeley, there is not much they can do to help you 'enforce' this rule. Two weeks is considered to be reaonsable, and if you really need another week you can talk to the recruiter.

children.subject: From my understanding, there’s nothing you can “do” about the situation, but if you inform Berkeley, that company will be no longer allowed to recruit on campus.

That penalty is only applied if a company is having repeat poor behavior, such as exploding offers, rescinding offers, etc. Informing the career center about this particular instance of not extending a two week offer won't do much.
Of course it may not help this particular student, but that doesn't mean he/she/they shouldn't speak up.
Could you clarify where it says in the policy that it's just a recommendation? From my understanding, this is school policy and not a recommendation.
I'm L&S CS. Does this still apply?
yeah :( "Note that Berkeley Engineering’s guidelines apply to any student currently declared as an engineering major, including L&S computer science majors or minors and M.E.T. students."
the college of engineering guideline does say 2 weeks, and this is what my recruiter hit me with when I brought up the general Berkeley guidelines so I'm not sure there's much you can do.

You can speak to the advisors at the Career Center to discuss the situation - they have virtual appointments through Handshake and are helpful in helping determine your options and crafting emails to the recruiter

Absolutely it does, companies should abide by fair and non-explosive hiring practices.

Please stop trying to shame OP into silence, it's counterproductive for everyone.
Does having 1 extra week really impact you so much that you are willing to try to harm the reputation of the company with the career center?

history.content:
I received an offer from a company on 11/10 and cited our career center guideline that we should be given 3 weeks: https://career.berkeley.edu/Employers/EmpPolicy.

The employer gave me 2 weeks despite being sent this policy and sent this email:

"I definitely understand it's a big decision -- we can extend to November 24 for now and reconnect then so that you've had two weeks to think it over. We typically can't hold positions for more than two weeks since we need to get back to other students as well. If you end up needing more time by the 24th, you and I can chat to figure out the best way forward -- does that work for you? I'm also happy to chat with your advisor at school to talk through the reasoning for this if it would help!"

Who can I contact at Berkeley to help get my 3 week extension?
history.subject: Given only 2 weeks for job offer deadline, but our policy says we have 3 weeks.
